description: From South African Dutch riempje, later Afrikaans riempie, diminutive form of riem.

entries.meaning: (South Africa) Made of or featuring crisscrossed leather strips. [from 20th c.]
examples: But back on the farm he submitted obediently to the routine of his parents: morning prayers, evening prayers – reading from his father's Dutch Bible, singing, kneeling at the riempie chairs until one's knees were aching […].

entries.meaning: (South Africa) A strip of worked leather, especially as used to form crisscrossed patterns on the back of chairs etc. [from 19th c.]
